alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Washington; Western Addison (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Addison and southwestern Washington Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cornwall, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Middlebury, Cornwall, Weybridge, Salisbury, Ripton, Bristol, Lincoln, Whiting, New Haven, Bridport, Granville, Starksboro, Shoreham, Waltham, Addison, Hancock, Monkton, East Middlebury, West Lincoln, and Lake Dunmore. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
